org.easybatch.integration.hibernate

Class HibernateTransactionStepListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.easybatch.integration.hibernate.HibernateTransactionStepListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordProcessorEventListener

    public class HibernateTransactionStepListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements RecordProcessorEventListener
    Listener that commits a Hibernate transaction after inserting a predefined number of records (commit-interval).
    Author:
    Mahmoud Ben Hassine (mahmoud@benhassine.fr)

    • Constructor Detail

      • HibernateTransactionStepListener

        public HibernateTransactionStepListener(org.hibernate.Session session)
        Create a Hibernate transaction listener.

        A Hibernate transaction will be committed after each record.

        Parameters:
        session - the Hibernate session

      • HibernateTransactionStepListener

        public HibernateTransactionStepListener(org.hibernate.Session session,
                                int commitInterval)
        Create a Hibernate transaction listener with a commit-interval value.
        Parameters:
        session - the Hibernate session
        commitInterval - the commit interval

      • beforeRecordProcessing

        public java.lang.Object beforeRecordProcessing(java.lang.Object record)
        Description copied from interface: RecordProcessorEventListener
        Called before the record gets processed. If you create a new record, you must keep the original header of the modified record.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        record - The record that will be processed.
